Package imagingbook.lib.math.eigen

Class EigensolverNxN

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagingbook.lib.math.eigen.EigensolverNxN
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RealEigensolver
    public class EigensolverNxN
extends java.lang.Object
implements RealEigensolver
    Calculates eigenvalues and eigenvectors of square matrices of arbitrary size. Eigenvalues are sorted by magnitude (in descending order). A matrix may have complex eigenvalues but only real eigenvalues (and their associated eigenvectors) are considered. Associated eigenvalues and eigenvectors share the same index (k = 0,...,N-1) but are not sorted in any particular order. Uses class EigenDecomposition of the Apache Commons Math (3) library.
    Usage example (retrieving all eigenvalues and associated eigenvectors): 
     double[][] A = {
        { 5, 2, 0, 1 },
        { 2, 5, 0, 7 },
        { -3, 4, 6, 0 },
        { 1, 2, 3, 4 }};
 
 RealEigensolver solver = new EigensolverNxN(A);
 
 double[] eigenvals = solver.getEigenvalues();
 for (int k = 0; k < solver.getSize(); k++) {
        double lambda = solver.getEigenvalue(k);
        if (Double.isFinite(lambda)) {
                double[] x = solver.getEigenvector(k);
                ...
        }
 }
    Version:
    2021/11/25

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition getDecomposition()  
      double getEigenvalue​(int k)
      Returns the k-th eigenvalue (λ_k, for k = 0,...,N-1).
      double[] getEigenvalues()
      Returns a vector of real eigenvalues in no specific order.
      double[] getEigenvector​(int k)
      Returns the k-th eigenvector (x_k, for k = 0,...,N-1).
      double[][] getEigenvectors()
      Returns a matrix whose columns are the eigenvectors of the solution, arranged in the same order as the eigenvalues returned by RealEigensolver.getEigenvalues().
      int getSize()
      Returns the size of the system (N = number of rows and columns).
      boolean isReal()
      Returns true iff all eigenvalues of the associated matrix are real.

        public double[] getEigenvector​(int k)
